column4: does anyone know how I can remove the hidden partition on my HDD that is not in fstab from Places>Computer
what does mount say, anything showing?
it is not mounted, it has no mount point, it shows up in Places>Computer as unmounted and if i try and open it i have to enter my pass
what type of partition is it, ext3? ntfs? was it mounted before?
it is ntfs
you want to delete it altogether?
since install it has had no mount point as i do not want it to show
no it is my recovery partition
thought so, dell or ibm have that
its a lenovo laptop
well Bassetts im not sure, i know you can prob. go into the config editor somehow and do it that way
or even disable the protection for it in the BIOS and just have ubuntu on it
i have looked cant find it
disbale protection? I want to keep the partition
ok ok
give me min, i'll try looking :)
thanks
mad_goldfis1, gtkpod
Applications -> System Tools -> Configuration Editor -> apps -> nautilus -> desktop and unchecked "volumes_visible"
does that not remove the icon for any removeable media?
the volume is still in Places>Computer
